answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some articles that may be helpful as a start to your research.
An organization called eCivis has created programs to improve grant management systems. 
http://icma.org/en/Article/10189/Improving_Grant_Performance_with_eCivis
http://icma.org/en/Article/10232/eCivis_IG_Corporate_Partner_Plans_Major_Enhancements_to_Grants_Locator
This is the main eCivis Website.
http://www.ecivis.com/
Alachua County, FL uses the Grant Opportunity Tools program to handle grants. 
http://icma.org/en/Article/10889/A_Shared_Vision_for_Improved_Grants_Success_Within_Alachua_County
In King County, WA worked with eCityGov Alliance to help develop an online portal management system for their Human Services grants. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/303241/Regional_Human_Service_Grant_Portal_HSConnectnet
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern 
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Jennifer Pfiffner
text:
Our organization is currently looking for a grant management software package to manage our nearly $7 million in grant funds.
Any suggestions on software packages would be very helpful.  Thank you!
title: Grants Management Software?
